title: Where can I get Ratnam pens? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ratnam pens are made in rajahmundry and they have official store in rajahmundry, andhrapradesh. It’s basically 2 brands RATNAM and RATNAMSON. They will have ready made variety of models availble with them - all hand crafted and they will even make you a custom pen depending on your need. These pens have a legacy some of the most sold Indian fountain made pens during the time of independence. The pens are unique and have a classic touch of Indian design. They are best and well known for their nib quality and smooth flow of ink. You can call and order them anytime. Through their cell number : 098489 18904‬ or if you personally visit their store in rajahmundry, you will have a great experience seeing their collections and pen manufacturing process. They do have lot of models. They look similar but varries in different sizes and colours. They offer full made gold and silver pens as well for a reasonable prices when compared to the international brands.    Each and every pen they make are well crafted and tested. It takes a period of 14 days for making a custom pen, and mainly depending on your order. These can be serviced anytime during the pens lifetime. I had recently give my moms 35 year old Ratnam pen for service, they have neatly polished and and changed every part which ever is possible for a cost of 50₹. Now a days they are coming up with some special and rare colours including shades in black and other textures. The pen is a lifetime pen and you could have a wonderful experience having it. I conclude by saying it as a Royal Enfeild in Indian pen industry. A rare classic touch on any desk, office or student table. And the comfort of writing it gives is unique of its kind. The attached below are the models they will have ready made. Which would help you making your choice.

Google them, and call them directly. I would personally suggest going for ratnam supreme or a ratnam 302. You have two options - ratnamson and guider. Just Google them and then call them. All the best.
